intro: Aria crantzii, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Aria crantzii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
